title: How to Become a DIY Drip Irrigation: Affordable and Easy Expert

subtasks: Connecting garden hose to water source
Attaching a timer to the garden hose
Connecting a pressure regulator to the timer
Adding a backflow preventer to the pressure regulator
Installing a filter after the backflow preventer
Laying out tubing for water distribution
Punching holes in tubing for emitter placement
Attaching emitters to holes, considering plant water requirements
Testing the system for leaks and making adjustments
Choosing appropriate emitter types and placement
Recognizing the role of a garden hose, timer, pressure regulator, backflow preventer, filter, tubing, and emitters

tasks.task: Assembling a DIY irrigation system, which includes subtasks like gathering materials, connecting components, laying tubing, attaching emitters, testing. Additionally, planning the system and understanding its components would be other main tasks. But the key thing is that most of the transcript is focused on the step-by-step process of building the system, so that's the core MAINTASK.
